English:
Research <res>Construction I</res> at the <bd>Workshop</bd> to be able to build more advanced buildings.

To research a technology, open an idle <bd>Workshop</bd> or open the Technology panel in the top left of the screen.
Italian:
Ricerca <res>Costruzione I</res> al <bd>Laboratorio</bd> per costruire edifici più avanzati!

Per ricercare una tecnologia, apri un <bd>Laboratorio</bd> inattivo oppure apri il pannello Tecnologia in alto a sinistra dello schermo

English:
You can upgrade <bd>Residences</bd> to produce Level 2 <it>Energy</it>.

<it>Energy L2</it> is used by the upgraded <bd>Workshop</bd> to research more advanced technologies.

<it>Energy L2</it> is also used by the <bd>Shaft Mine</bd> and Level 2 <bd>Surface Mine</bd> to excavate <nr>Coal</nr>, <nr>Iron Ore</nr>, <nr>Salt</nr> and <nr>Clay</nr>.
Italian:
Puoi migliorare le <bd>Residenze</bd> per produrre <it>Energia</it> di Livello 2.

L'<it>Energia L2</it> è inoltre usata dalla <bd>Miniera</bd> e dalla <bd>Miniera di Superficie</bd> Livello 2 per estrarre <nr>Carbone</nr>, <nr>Ferro grezzo</nr>, <nr>Sale</nr> e <nr>Argilla</nr>

English:
Level 2 <bd>Residences</bd> need <cat>Alcohol</cat> to be able to generate the more powerful <it>Energy L2</it> needed at the Level 2 <bd>Workshop</bd> and to mine <it>Iron Ore</it> and <it>Coal</it>.

Build an <bd>Orchard</bd> and <bd>Cider Press</bd> to start producing <it>Cider</it>.
Italian:
Le <bd>Residenze</bd> Livello 2 hanno bisogno di <cat>Alcohol</cat> per poter generare <it>Energia L2</it> necessaria al <bd>Laboratorio</bd> di Livello 2 e per estrarre <it>Ferro grezzo</it> e <it>Carbone</it>.

Costruisci un <bd>Frutteto</bd> e una <bd>Pressa per Sidro</bd> per iniziare a produrre del <it>Sidro</it>.

English: Begin mining <nr>Coal</nr> by building a Level 2 <bd>Surface Mine</bd> or <bd>Shaft Mine</bd> depending on whether it's a surface deposit or an underground deposit.
Italian: Inizia ad estrarre del <nr>Carbone</nr> costruendo una <bd>Miniera di Superficie</bd> Livello 2 o una <bd>Miniera</bd> a seconda se è un deposito in superficie o sotterraneo

English: Begin mining <nr>Iron Ore</nr> by building a Level 2 <bd>Surface Mine</bd> or <bd>Shaft Mine</bd> depending on whether it's a surface deposit or an underground deposit.
Italian: Inizia ad estrarre <nr>Ferro grezzo</nr> costruendo una <bd>Miniera di Superficie</bd> di Livello 2 o una <bd>Miniera</bd> a seconda se è un deposito in superficie o sotterraneo.

English: Build a <bd>Blast Furnace</bd> to create <it>Iron</it> from <it>Iron Ore</it> and <it>Coal</it>.
Italian: Costruisci un <bd>Altoforno</bd> per ottenere <it>Ferro</it> dal <it>Ferro grezzo</it> e <it>Carbone</it>.

English: Build a <bd>Well</bd> to supply <it>Water</it> to your <bd>Residences</bd>.
Italian: Costruisci un <bd>Pozzo</bd> per fornire <it>Acqua</it> alle tue <bd>Residenze</bd>.

English: Build a <bd>Harbour</bd> on the shore to discover new islands and more resources.
Italian: Costruisci un <bd>Porto</bd> sulla costa per scoprire nuove isole e altre risorse.

English: If you run out of trees your Log supply may fail. Build a <bd>Forester</bd> to plant more trees.
Italian: Se finisci gli alberi la tua produzione di Tronchi potrebbe interrompersi. Costruisci una <bd>Guardia Forestale</bd> per piantare altri alberi.

English: Build a <bd>Boatyard</bd> on the shore line and construct your first boat so you can explore the high seas.
Italian: Costruisci un <bd>Cantiere Navale</bd> sulla costa e costruisci la tua prima barca per esplorare il mare.

English: Before you can explore the seas you need the resources to build a new <bd>Harbour</bd> on newly discovered land. In the expedition tab at your existing <bd>Harbour</bd> start gathering the necessary resources.
Italian: Prima che tu possa esplorare il mare hai bisogno di risorse per costruire un nuovo <bd>Porto</bd> nella zona scoperta. Inizia a prepare le risorse nella scheda Spedizione del tuo <bd>Porto</bd>.

Italian: Le risorse per la spedizione sono pronte! Trova una barca inattiva per assegnarla alla spedizione.

Italian: Usando la scheda Navigazione sulla tua barca puoi navigare liberamente. Quando scopri una nuova zona costruisci un porto su una zona costiera adatta. Una volta costruito, la barca imposterà automaticamente una rotta commerciale tra i due porti.

English: Build a <bd>Harbour</bd> on a new island!

Italian: Ricerca <res>Estrazione I</res> al <bd>Laboratorio</bd> Livello 2 per sbloccare la <bd>Miniera di Superficie</bd> Livello 2 e la <bd>Miniera</bd> Livello 1 in modo da poter estrarre <nr>Carbone</nr> e <nr>Ferro gresso</nr>

English: You can upgrade <bd>Workshops</bd> in order to research more advanced technologies including ore mining.
Italian: Puoi migliorare i <bd>Laboratori</bd> in modo da poter ricercare tecnologie più avanzate, inclusa l'estrazione del Ferro.

English: You can instruct your Lumberbots to chop down specific trees via the priority panel on a <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd>.

English:

Italian: Per creare <it>Ferro</it> un <bd>Altoforno</bd> ha bisogno di <it>Carbonella</it> da un <bd>Bruciatore di Carbonella</bd> o di <it>Carbone</it> da una <bd>Miniera di Superficie</bd> o da una <bd>Miniera</bd>

English:
The transport priorities determine which resource a carrybot will pick up from a road post or a stackbot will unload from a boat or train.

Resource types higher up the list will be picked up before resource types below it.

The transport priorities will be overridden if a resource heading to a <pr>Prioritised</pr> building is available to be picked up.

Use the arrows to move a resource type up or down the priority list.
Italian:
Le priorità di trasporto determinano la risorsa che un BotTrasportatore prenderà da un posto di strada o uno BotImpilatore scaricherà da una nave o da un treno.

I tipi di risorse più in alto nell'elenco verranno raccolti prima dei tipi di risorse sottostanti.

Le priorità di trasporto saranno ignorate se è disponibile per essere ritirata una risorsa destinata a un edificio <pr>Prioritizzato</pr>.

Utilizza le frecce per spostare un tipo di risorsa in alto o in basso nell'elenco delle priorità.

English:
If two buildings that are under construction immediately need the same resource type, these priorities determine which building type the resource will head to first.

These construction priorities will be overridden by <pr>Prioritised</pr> building.

Use the arrows to move a building type up or down the priority list.
Italian:
Se due edifici in costruzione necessitano immediatamente dello stesso tipo di risorsa, queste priorità determinano a quale tipo di edificio la risorsa andrà per prima.

Queste priorità di costruzione saranno ignorate dagli edifici <pr>Prioritizzati</pr>.

Utilizza le frecce per spostare un tipo di edificio in alto o in basso nell'elenco delle priorità.

English:

You can click on a building type to view all of your buildings of that type.
Italian:
Questo pannello elenca tutti i tuoi edifici per tipologia e la loro attuale produttività.

Puoi fare clic su un tipo di edificio per visualizzare tutti i tuoi edifici di quel tipo.

English:
You can research various technologies to unlock new buildings and transport modes which improve and advance your colony.

Technologies are researched by researchbots at the <bd>Workshop</bd> building. Researchbots require <it>Energy</it> to research technology as well as resources specific to that technology.

More advanced technologies require higher level <bd>Workshops</bd> which in turn requrie more advanced <it>Energy</it> to function.

To start researching a technology, first select an available technology on a tech tree. Then select an idle <bd>workshop</bd> that is at the required or higher level.

Finally click on the Start Research button in the bottom right to being the research.
Italian:
Puoi ricercare varie tecnologie per sbloccare nuovi edifici e modalità di trasporto che migliorano e fanno avanzare la tua colonia.

Le tecnologie sono ricercate dai robot di ricerca nell'edificio <bd>Laboratorio</bd>. I robot di ricerca richiedono <it>Energia</it> per ricercare la tecnologia e risorse specifiche per tale tecnologia.

Tecnologie più avanzate richiedono <bd>Laboratori</bd> di livello superiore che a loro volta richiedono <it>Energia</it> più avanzata per funzionare.

Per iniziare la ricerca di una tecnologia, selezionare prima una tecnologia disponibile su un albero tecnologico. Quindi seleziona un <bd>Laboratorio</bd> inattivo che è al livello richiesto o superiore.

Infine, fai clic sul pulsante Avvia ricerca in basso a destra per avviare la ricerca.

English:
The map shows a top down view of your colony. You can zoom in using the mouse wheel or the slider on the left. You can also left-click and drag to pan around the map.

On the right-hand side panel is a list of surface and underground natural resource deposits. You can toggle the visibility of each on the map.

By default, the location of unrevealed natural resources are also indicated on the map. These can help you decide in which direction to expand and navigate your expeditions.

And remember, if you run out of higher level resources, you are always able to expand using Level 1 <bd>Watchtowers</bd> and harvest surface stone deposits using Level 1 <bd>Surface Mines</bd>.
Italian:
Questa mappa mostra una vista dall'alto in basso della tua colonia. Puoi ingrandire usando la rotellina del mouse o il cursore a sinistra. 
Puoi anche fare clic con il tasto sinistro e trascinare per spostarti all'interno della mappa.

Sul pannello laterale destro è presente un elenco di depositi di risorse naturali di superficie e sotterranei. Puoi attivare o disattivare la visibilità di ciascuno sulla mappa.

Per impostazione predefinita, la posizione delle risorse naturali non rivelate è indicata anche sulla mappa. Questi possono aiutarti a decidere in quale direzione espandere e navigare le tue spedizioni.

E ricorda, se esaurisci le risorse di livello superiore, sei sempre in grado di espanderti usando una <bd>Torre di guardia</bd> di Livello 1 e di estrarre pietre dai depositi usando una <bd>Miniera di superficie</bd> di Livello 1.

English:
This sub-panel shows you the current productivity of your colony. This is the percentage of your production buildings that are currently active.

You can also view your colony productivity over the last week or month on the graph.
Italian:
Questo pannello secondario mostra l'attuale produttività della tua colonia. Questa è la percentuale degli edifici di produzione attualmente attivi.

Puoi anche visualizzare sul grafico la produttività della tua colonia nell'ultima settimana o mese.

English:
This sub-panel lists resources recently delivered to a production building. You can filter the results by 'On Time', 'Warning' and 'Alert' and you can select any entry to see the route it took. The percentage number indicates the time the journey took compared to the time needed to maintain 100% productivity at the destination building.

For example, a <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> requires <it>Energy</it> at a rate of one per day and can store up to four <it>Energy</it> resources as a buffer. If an <it>Energy</it> resource takes 4.5 days to arrive, it will be listed here as 112% as if that journey time was consistent then resources wouldn't arrive quickly enough to maintain 100% productivity.

This is just one factor When taking into account whether a building can work at 100% as you also need to take into account whether there is enough of that resource being produced in the first place.

It is usually optimal to place a building that supply another building close together so that supply routes are short. Sometimes this is not possible but to work around this you can build <bd>Storage Yards</bd> near your destination to create an extra supply 'buffer'.

For example, if you have a remote <bd>Mine</bd>, you can build a nearby <bd>Storage Yard</bd> to keep a supply of <it>Energy</it> nearby. If you do this bear in mind that, by default, the <it>Energy</it> stored there will still be available to other buildings, potentially far away. There are two options to make it so that <it>Energy</it> only goes to that <bd>Mine</bd>:

Firstly you could limit the export buildings in the <bd>Storage Yard</bd> settings to just your <bd>Mine</bd>. Secondly you could create a transport rule on a road post to only allow <it>Energy</it> to pass through if going to a <bd>Storage Yard</bd>.
Italian:
Questo pannello secondario elenca le risorse consegnate di recente a un edificio di produzione. Puoi filtrare i risultati in base a" In orario"," Allerta" e "Allarme" e puoi selezionare qualsiasi voce per vedere il percorso seguito. Il numero percentuale indica che il tempo impiegato per il viaggio rispetto al tempo necessario per mantenere la produttività del 100% nell'edificio di destinazione.

Ad esempio, una <bd>Capanna del Taglialegna</bd> richiede <it>Energia</it> al prezzo di una al giorno e può archiviare fino a quattro risorse <it>Energia</it> come buffer. Se una risorsa <it>Energia</it> impiega 4,5 giorni per arrivare, verrà elencata qui come 112% come se quel tempo di viaggio fosse coerente, quindi le risorse non arriverebbero abbastanza rapidamente per mantenere una produttività del 100%.

Questo è solo uno dei fattori. Quando si tiene conto del fatto che un edificio possa funzionare al 100%, si deve anche tenere conto del fatto che in primo luogo viene prodotta abbastanza quella risorsa.

Di solito è ottimale posizionare un edificio che rifornisca un altro edificio vicino in modo che i percorsi di approvvigionamento siano brevi. A volte ciò non è possibile, ma per ovviare a questo problema è possibile creare <bd>Depositi</bd> vicino alla destinazione per creare un "buffer" di approvvigionamento aggiuntivo.

Ad esempio, se possiedi uan <bd>Miniera</bd> remota, puoi costruire un <bd>Deposito</bd> nelle vicinanze per mantenere un rifornimento di <it>Energia</it> nelle vicinanze. Se lo fai, tieni presente che, per impostazione predefinita, l '<it>Energia</it> immagazzinata sarà comunque disponibile per altri edifici, potenzialmente lontani. Ci sono due opzioni per farlo in modo che <it>Energia</it> vada solo a quella <bd>Miniera</bd>:

In primo luogo potresti limitare gli edifici di esportazione nelle impostazioni <bd>Deposito </bd> solo alla tua <bd>Miniera</bd>. In secondo luogo, è possibile creare una regola di trasporto su un Palo Stradale per consentire il passaggio di <it>Energia</it> solo se si va in un <bd>Deposito</bd>.

English:
By default, resource priorities are determined by the order set in the demands panel for each resource.

However, you can also prioritise a single building over all others by using this button (or holding <hotkey>[P]</hotkey> and clicking the building).

Once prioritised, a pink star will appear above the building and it will appear at the top of the demand list of all resources that it is trying to source.

For example, if you have a Level 1 Watchtower that you wish to build as quickly as possible then Prioritising your Watchtower will mean it receives all available Logs produced ahead of any other buildings that may also currently need Logs.

You are able to set one Priority building per building type.
Italian:
Per impostazione predefinita, le priorità delle risorse sono determinate dall'ordine impostato nel pannello delle richieste per ciascuna risorsa.

Tuttavia, puoi anche dare la priorità a un singolo edificio rispetto a tutti gli altri usando questo pulsante (o tenendo premuto <hotkey>[P]</hotkey> e facendo clic sull'edificio).

Una volta assegnata la priorità, una stella rosa apparirà sopra l'edificio e apparirà in cima all'elenco della domanda di tutte le risorse che sta cercando di reperire.

Ad esempio, se si dispone di una Torre di guardia di Livello 1 che si desidera costruire il più rapidamente possibile, dare priorità alla Torre di guardia significa che riceverà tutti i Tronchi disponibili prodotti prima di qualsiasi altro edificio che potrebbe anche aver bisogno di Tronchi.

.Puoi impostare un edificio prioritario per tipo di edificio.

English:
The Resource Overview panel gives you an general insight into how much a particular resource is being produced and how much it is in demand.

Current Production is the amount being produced right now based on active buildings.

Potential Production is the amount that would be produced if all your production buildings were active.

Current Demand is the amount that is currently being required across your colony, whether for production, construction, research or military purposes.

Potential Demand is the amount that would be required for production, construction, research or military if those buildings were active.

The positive and negative bars at the bottom indicate your surplus or deficit broken down into:

Current Surplus (Current Production versus Current Demand)
Potential Surplus (Potential Production versus Potential Demand)
Italian:
Il pannello Panoramica delle risorse offre una visione generale di quanto viene prodotta una determinata risorsa e di quanto è richiesta.

La produzione attuale è la quantità prodotta in questo momento sulla base di edifici attivi.

La produzione potenziale è la quantità che verrebbe prodotta se tutti gli edifici di produzione fossero attivi.

La domanda attuale è la quantità attualmente richiesta in tutta la tua colonia, sia per produzione, costruzione, ricerca o scopi militari.

La domanda potenziale è l'importo che sarebbe necessario per la produzione, la costruzione, la ricerca o l'esercito se tali edifici fossero attivi.

Le barre positive e negative in basso indicano il tuo avanzo o deficit suddiviso in:

Eccedenza attuale (produzione attuale rispetto alla domanda attuale)

Potenziale surplus (produzione potenziale contro domanda potenziale)

English:
You can add rules to a road post or transport building to help direct resources around your colony in particular ways.

Blacklist: If you blacklist a resource it will not be able to pass through under any circumstance.

Blacklist Except Storage: This option means accept the resource if it's going to a storage yard.

Whitelist: means only the selected resources will be able to pass through.

Whitelist Storage Only: This option means only whitelisted resources will be able to pass through and only if they're going to a storage yard.
Italian:
Puoi aggiungere regole a un Palo Stradale o a un edificio di trasporto per aiutare a dirigere le risorse intorno alla tua colonia in modi particolari.

Lista nera: se si inserisce nella lista nera una risorsa, questa non sarà in grado di passare in nessuna circostanza.

Lista nera (tranne archiviazione): questa opzione significa accettare la risorsa se va in un deposito.

Lista delle richieste: significa che solo le risorse selezionate saranno in grado di passare.

Lista delle richieste (solo deposito): questa opzione significa che solo le risorse nella lista deelle richieste saranno in grado di passare e solo se stanno andando in un deposito.

English:
This panel lists how much money you have, your current Trader Reputation and resource prices.

Trader Reputation points are gained by buying and selling resources. Gain enough points and your Trader Reputation will increase, allowing you to build another <bd>Space Port</bd>.

Purchasing resources incurs a 50% commission to deliver it to your chosen <bd>Space Port</bd>.
Italian:
Questo pannello elenca quanti soldi hai, la tua reputazione attuale del commerciante e i prezzi delle risorse.

I punti Reputazione dell'operatore vengono acquisiti acquistando e vendendo risorse. Guadagna abbastanza punti e la tua reputazione di commerciante aumenterà, permettendoti di costruire un altro <bd>Porto Spaziale</bd>.

L'acquisto di risorse comporta una commissione del 50% per la consegna al <bd>Porto Spaziale</bd> scelto.

English:
Buildings need to be connected to the road network for resources to be able to reach the building.

Buildings can be directly placed on roads or the building's entrance can be connected to a road by a path.

Additionally, a building can be directly connected by paths to one or more other buildings. This allows stackbots to move resources between buildings without involving a road post and can help keep traffic off your roads.

A road post or building connection has a maximum length of 20 tiles.

You can click on a connection in the list to see the route the Stackbot takes.
Italian:
Gli edifici devono essere collegati alla rete stradale affinché le risorse possano raggiungere l'edificio.

Gli edifici possono essere posizionati direttamente sulle strade o l'ingresso dell'edificio può essere collegato a una strada tramite un sentiero.

Inoltre, un edificio può essere collegato direttamente tramite percorsi a uno o più altri edifici. Ciò consente ai BotImpilatori di spostare le risorse tra gli edifici senza coinvolgere un palo stradale e può aiutare a mantenere il traffico lontano dalle strade.

Una strada o un collegamento di un edificio ha una lunghezza massima di 20 tessere.

È possibile fare clic su una connessione nell'elenco per vedere il percorso del BotImpilatore.

English:
By the middle of the 21st century, significant advancements had been made in the fields of robotics and artificial intelligence.

Scientists had begun developing self-aware printable robots, capable of simulating human needs for sustenance and shelter.

English:
Faced with an indefinite future of servitude, one group of robots hatched a plan to create a new life for themselves.

Realising there would be no place on Earth they could enjoy freedom without persecution, they looked to the heavens.

They commandeered the nearest rocket ship and flew out into the darkness of the solar system in search of a new home where they would be free to fulfil their dream: to be human...

Rendendosi conto che non ci sarebbe posto sulla Terra che avrebbero potuto godere della libertà senza persecuzioni, guardarono il cielo.

Hanno rubato il razzo più vicino e sono volati nell'oscurità del sistema solare alla ricerca di una nuova casa dove sarebbero stati liberi di realizzare il loro sogno: essere umani...

Logs are used in the construction of basic buildings but are also needed to make <it>Planks</it> at the <bd>Sawmill</bd>, <it>Charcoal</it> at the <bd>Charcoal Burner</bd>, <it>Paper</it> at the <bd>Paper Mill</bd> and <it>Arrows</it> at the <bd>Fletcher</bd>.

Watch out for warnings when your available trees run low and look at building <bd>Forestries</bd> to keep your Logs supplies going. Your <bd>Colony Ship</bd> also generates a slow supply of Logs so you never run out.

Fai attenzione agli avvisi quando i tuoi alberi disponibili scarseggiano e ricorda di costruire <bd>Foreste</bd> per far andare avanti le scorte di tronchi. La tua <bd>nave della Colonia</bd> genera anche una fornitura lenta di tronchi in modo da non rimanere mai senza.

English:
A path connects a building to a road or road post.

A building's stackbot uses paths to collect and drop off resources at road posts.

Paths do not have a maximum length but the longer the path, the more time it takes a stackbot to drop off and collect resources which may lead to delays.                                                    

Paths can useful as they allow direct delivery between buildings which can reduce the traffic on your roads.
Italian:
Un percorso collega un edificio a una strada o ad un palo stradale.

Il BotImpilatore di un edificio utilizza percorsi per raccogliere e scaricare risorse sui pali stradali.

I percorsi non hanno una lunghezza massima ma più lungo è il percorso, più tempo impiega un BotImilatore a scendere e raccogliere risorse che possono causare ritardi.

I percorsi possono essere utili in quanto consentono la consegna diretta tra edifici che può ridurre il traffico sulle strade.

English:
A road is a connection between two road posts. Road posts can hold four resources and each road has a Carrybot who moves resources between the posts.

Roads have a minimum length of 4 tiles and a maximum length of 6 tiles.

To build a road, click on an existing road post and then click on the tile you want to end on.

Hold <hotkey>[Ctrl]</hotkey> when clicking a tile to fix a waypoint in your prospective road.
Italian:
Una strada è un collegamento tra due incroci. I pali stradali possono contenere quattro risorse e ogni strada ha un BotTrasportatore che sposta le risorse tra i pali.

Le strade hanno una lunghezza minima di 4 caselle e una lunghezza massima di 6 caselle.

Per costruire una strada, fai clic su un palo stradale esistente, quindi fai clic sul riquadro su cui vuoi terminare.

Tieni premuto <hotkey>[Ctrl]</hotkey> quando fai clic su una casella per fissare un waypoint nella tua potenziale strada.

You are always able to construct Level 1 buildings if you run out of resources for higher level ones.

English: Basic coal engine with three hoppers

Fantastic! You now have the capacity to produce more <it>Energy L1</it>.
But more <bd>Residences</bd> mean more Housebot needs, so demand for <it>Water</it> and <cat>Food</cat> has also increased.
Build another <bd>Fishing Hut</bd> on the coast to increase your <cat>Food</cat> production.
We're near the shore and have several jumping fish tiles available which can be farmed by a <bd>Fishing Hut</bd>.

Great! <bd>Watchtowers</bd> take a little longer to build though.
While your <bd>Watchtower</bd> is being built, let's construct a <bd>Forestry</bd> to plant some more trees.
Now click the flashing Build icon in the bottom right of the screen.

So the demand is now greater than the supply of <it>Energy L1</it>. This means eventually the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> and <bd>Surface Mine</bd> won't be able to work at 100% efficiency.
Build two more <bd>Residences</bd> to increase the supply of <it>Energy L1</it>!
Another tip: you can <hotkey>[Ctrl]</hotkey> + select a building to duplicate it.
Select <lr>Path</lr> building mode and then build a <lr>Path</lr> on the highlighted tiles.#

Excellent! Your <bd>Well</bd> will soon be built and <it>Water</it> will be supplied to the <bd>Residence</bd>.
Because the <bd>Well</bd> and the <bd>Residence</bd> are connected by a path, the Stackbot can deliver the <it>Water</it> directly.
This means the <it>Water</it> resource will not impact your road network and can help reduce traffic on your roads when your colony grows and gets busier.

The <bd>Colony Ship</bd> generates a small amount of <it>Energy L1</it> to get you started but your colony will soon require lots more.
You can generate additional <it>Energy L1</it> at <bd>Residences</bd> so next let's build your first <bd>Residence</bd>.

Great, your territory has expanded and now includes the <nr>Stone Deposit</nr>!
Go ahead and build a <bd>Surface Mine</bd> to mine the <nr>Stone Deposit</nr> and start producing <it>Stone</it>.

First you need to build a <bd>Watchtower</bd> near the <nr>Stone Deposit</nr> to expand your borders.
You can choose where to build the <bd>Watchtower</bd> yourself but you'll need to place it near the border so you can access the <nr>Stone Deposit</nr>.

To produce <it>Energy L1</it> the first resource a <bd>Residence</bd> needs is <it>Water</it>.
Build a <bd>Well</bd> at the highlighted tiles.

You have some <nr>Stone Deposit</nr> just outside your territory on the other side of the island.
Click on it now.
Again go ahead and use a path to connect your <bd>Fishing Hut</bd> to the <lr>Road</lr> network using <lr>Paths</lr>.

Again you need to connect the building to the road network to allow resources to reach it.
Buildings can be connected to any point along a road. Build a <lr>Road</lr> on the highlighted locations.

Great! Buildings can be connected to any point along a road.
Each building has a Stackbot to collect and drop off resources. The one at your <bd>Residence</bd> will use both road posts.

Looks good! Now you need to connect your <bd>Watchtower</bd> to the network with <lr>Roads</lr> and <lr>Paths</lr>.
You can quick select different build modes by using hotkeys <hotkey>[1]</hotkey> to <hotkey>[9]</hotkey>.
You can also remove buildings, roads and paths using the Destroy tool in the bottom right. Be careful what you remove though as it can disrupt your colony!

In this construction panel the arrows tell you which resources the building produces and the resources required to do so.
It also shows you the construction materials and how long construction will take.

Good! Your <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> needs <it>Logs</it> for it to be constructed though.You can see there is an outstanding demand for <it>Logs</it> by the icon on the building and the red icons in the bottom left of the screen.Click on the flashing <it>Logs</it> icon on the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> building.

This panel tells you the construction progress and how many resources are needed.
The red circle on the <it>Logs</it> icon means that this <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> immediately needs <it>Logs</it> for construction of the building.

The production panel of a building tells you the needs, status and current output of a building.
Some bots, such as Lumberbots, need extra power to carry out their job.

This extra power is provided by the <it>Energy</it> resource.
This panel tells you that the Lumberbot needs one Level 1 <it>Energy</it> resource per day to keep working.
The other <bd>Residence</bd> need was <cat>Food</cat>. This means <it>Fish</it> or <it>Meat</it>.

Buildings also don't need to be placed directly on <lr>Roads</lr>. They can be connected to a <lr>Road</lr> by a <lr>Path</lr>.
<lr>Paths</lr> are secondary routes that allow a building's Stackbot to reach a road post. This allows you to be more flexible with your building and road placement.

This panel now tells you how much <it>Energy L1</it> this <bd>Residence</bd> can generate and which resources are needed to do so.
The Level 1 <bd>Residence</bd> turns one <it>Water</it> and one <cat>Food</cat> resource into one <it>Energy L1</it>.

You control where the Treebot plants their trees.
Follow the yellow alert icons on the <bd>Forestry</bd> building and allocate some tiles for planting.
Well done! This means you won't run out of trees for Lumberbots to create <it>Logs</it> out of.

At last, terra firma!
We have finally reached a habitable planet and we can set our wheels to ground.

You are Dronebot <name> and are in charge of colony operations.
This looks like a good island to test our anthrobotic systems.
While your crew are unloading your few starting resources here are some basics:
The <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> is complete! Now the <bd>Colony Ship</bd> will print a Lumberbot and they will head to the new building.

The Lumberbot has arrived and has headed off to work! You may have noticed that another resource was delivered to the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd>.
Click on your new <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> building to find out more.
You can also use your mouse to move around:
<hotkey>Right-click</hotkey> and drag to move about the world as well as move the mouse to the edge of screen.
Hold and drag the <hotkey>middle mouse button</hotkey> to rotate and tilt the camera.

You can use <hotkey>[F]</hotkey> to flip a building's orientation.
Use <hotkey>[F]</hotkey> to flip and <hotkey>[R]</hotkey> to rotate to build a <bd>Fishing Hut</bd> on the highlighted location.
You're in the build mode, so place the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> on the highlighted tiles near your Colony Ship.
You can rotate a building when you're placing it. Rotate using <hotkey>[R]</hotkey> and match the <bd>Residence</bd> to the highlighted tiles.
Click the highlighted tab to go to the <it>Logs</it> overview panel.
First, close the resource panel by <hotkey>right-clicking</hotkey> anywhere inside the panel or by using the 'x' button.

This section tells you how many <it>Logs</it> you're producing and how many are in demand. This is a good panel to check whether you're producing enough of a resource.
<it>Logs</it> are an important construction material and your <bd>Colony Ship</bd> has a basic replicator which slowly produces <it>Logs</it> to ensure you never completely run out.
But you're going to need a lot more <it>Logs</it> so let's build a <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd>.

You have a few resources to get your colony up and running.
You can see how many of each resource you currently have in storage in the bottom left of the screen. Click the flashing <it>Logs</it> icon to open the resource info panel.

The resource panel tells you how many <it>Logs</it> you currently have stored and how much that number has changed over the last day or week.
Below that is the list of buildings where the resources are stored.
So you currently have 16 <it>Logs</it> stored at your <bd>Colony Ship</bd>.

You have some <it>Logs</it> at the <bd>Colony Ship</bd> but there is no route to your <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> yet as indicated by the yellow alert icon.
Resources move around your colony along <lr>Roads</lr>. Let's build one!
Select the <lr>Roads</lr> build mode in the bottom right of the screen.

Roads can only be started from existing road posts.
<hotkey>Click</hotkey> on the blue road post outside the <bd>Colony Ship</bd> and then <hotkey>click</hotkey> on the next highlighted tile.
Got it! Roads can be between 4 and 6 tiles long. Build another <lr>Road</lr> to connect your <bd>Lumberjack</bd>.
Great! Each <lr>Road</lr> has a Carrybot who moves resources between the posts at either end of the <lr>Road</lr> depending on where the resource needs to go.
You can increase and decrease the game speed in the top right of the screen or by using hotkeys:
Change game speed using buttons in top right of the screen.
Pause and unpause the game using <hotkey>[Space]</hotkey>.

<it>Stone</it> is used to build more advanced buildings.
You can mine this <nr>Stone Deposit</nr> with the <bd>Surface Mine</bd> but only once the deposit is inside your territory.

Nice work! Your Minerbot will now head off and begin harvesting <it>Stone</it>.
You may have noticed that the <bd>Surface Mine</bd> also requires <it>Energy L1</it> to function.
Click on the <it>Energy L1</it> panel in the bottom left to check the colony's <it>Energy L1</it> demands.
Excellent! You have a functioning colony and your skills are looking promising!
When you're ready, it's time to move onto somewhere with a bit more space...

The construction resources are now heading to the <bd>Fishing Hut</bd>.
Let's wait for construction for finish.

Your Carrybots can now transport the <it>Logs</it> along the roads to the road post outside the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd>.
The Stackbot for the <bd>Lumberjack Hut</bd> will then pick up the resources and the Buildbot will then be able to construct the building.
Let's watch!
Good! Now let's watch the construction resources reach the <bd>Residence</bd> and the buildbot finish their work.
The <bd>Residence</bd> is finished but as the icons above the building show the Housebot doesn't have the required resources yet to begin production of <it>Energy L1</it>.

Now let's wait for the <bd>Watchtower</bd> to finish construction.
Remember you can change the game speed with <hotkey>[Z]</hotkey> and <hotkey>[X]</hotkey>.
The Fisherbot is now heading off to fish and will soon have some <it>Fish</it> for your <bd>Residence</bd>.

First though, we can see that we haven't got any <nr>Fish</nr> available so you'll need to build a <bd>Sheep Farm</bd>.
Sheep Farms can produce enough <cat>Food</cat> for 4 <bd>Residences</bd> but they need space for the sheep to graze.
Build a <bd>Sheep Farm</bd> in the highlighted location.
Nice! Let's wait for the buildbot to finish construction of your <bd>Sheep Farm</bd>.

Now, starting at the post outside the <bd>Colony Ship</bd>, connect to the <bd>Sheep Farm</bd> using <lr>Roads</lr> and <lr>Paths</lr>.
You can also use hotkeys <hotkey>[1]</hotkey> through <hotkey>[9]</hotkey> to select different construction modes.

Your <bd>Sheep Farm</bd> won't produce at its most optimal rate until you place the full 50 pastures.
Click on the yellow alert symbol above the <bd>Sheep Farm</bd> building and click 'Auto Place'.

Click 'Auto Place' to automatically place the sheep pastures.
You can also manually modify the fields by clicking 'Change'.

Great! Your <bd>Sheep Farm</bd> is going to give you a good start on <cat>Food</cat> production.
If, at any point, you want to set the sheep pastures manually, you can use the 'Change' mode.

Great, you've researched <res>Construction I</res>!
This means you've unlocked a new range of buildings and the ability to upgrade some existing ones.
To mine <nr>Coal</nr> and <nr>Iron Ore</nr> you need to research <res>Mining I</res> as well as supply the more advanced <it>Energy L2</it>.

<it>Energy L2</it> is generated by Level 2 <bd>Residences</bd>.
You can either upgrade Level 1 <bd>Residences</bd> via the building's upgrade panel or you can construct the building from scratch.
Your next job is to create your first Level 2 <bd>Workshop</bd> and your first Level 2 <bd>Residence</bd>!

It's time to build this colony on your own!
I'll still be around to help though. Click on the flashing 'Help' icon the top-left.

Here you can see the mission goal as well as advice, warnings and tips if you need them.
You can also click on each advice item for more information.
Good luck!

This location looks a bit more promising! Let's build a <bd>Small Monument</bd> to celebrate!
A <bd>Small Monument</bd> requires more advanced materials including <it>Iron</it> and you're going to need to research technology to upgrade and unlock more advanced buildings.

We seem to have landed on a small island with few resources.
You're going to need to build a harbour and boatyard to explore the seas to find new land!

It looks like you might not be alone this planet...
You should set up your colony and expand quickly!

You now have some <nr>Coal</nr> deposits within your territory!
<nr>Coal</nr> deposits can only be mined by a Level 2 <bd>Surface Mine</bd> once you've researched <res>Mining I</res>.

You've built your first boat!
When a boat is complete you can either create a route between existing <bd>Harbours</bd> or assign it to an expedition to explore the seas and build a new <bd>Harbour</bd> on another island.
As this is your first boat you need to start collecting resources for an expedition at a <bd>Harbour</bd>. When ready, select your boat and assign it to the expedition.

Your new <bd>Harbour</bd> is under construction!
Your boat has also automatically created a transport route between your new <bd>Harbour</bd> and its original <bd>Harbour</bd>.
Resources will automatically be delivered through your <bd>Harbours</bd> when they are requested by buildings on either island.
As your colony expands you will want to control which resources can pass through your network in order to prevent resources being sourced from too far away or from different islands.
Check out the transport rule system by clicking on any road post or harbour.

Your expedition boat is ready!
Select it to enter navigation mode. You can now click on a water tile to explore the ocean and discover new islands.
You can check the Map (<hotkey>[M]</hotkey>) screen to see where the hidden resources are located.
Once you've found a new island, use the 'Build Harbour' option on the boat panel to construct a new <bd>Harbour</bd> your new land.

You now have access to Level 2 of this building!
Click the tabs at the top of the construction panel to change the level of the building.

You've come across another robot colony! They do not look friendly though...
Level 2 <bd>Watchtowers</bd> can attack nearby hostile <bd>Watchtowers</bd> with arrows.
Research military technologies and upgrade your <bd>Watchtowers</bd> to prepare for combat!

You've researched <res>Mining I</res>!
You can now build Level 2 <bd>Surface Mines</bd> and Level 1 <bd>Shaft Mines</bd> which can mine <nr>Coal</nr> and <nr>Iron Ore</nr>.

You now have a Level 2 <bd>Residence</bd> which can generate <it>Energy L2</it>!
Level 2 <bd>Residences</bd> have an additional requirement though - <cat>Alcohol</cat>.
Build an <bd>Orchard</bd> and <bd>Cider Press</bd> to start producing <it>Cider</it>.

You now have a Underground Deposit inside your territory!
You can mine this location by constructing a <bd>Shaft Mine</bd> on it.
When placing the <bd>Shaft Mine</bd> you need to line up the building footprint so the mine track lines up to the mine entrance.

You now have a Underground Deposit inside your territory!
You can mine this location by constructing a Level 1 <bd>Shaft Mine</bd>  once you've researched <res>Mining I</res>.

You have unlocked the Shaft Mine!
Level 1 Shaft Mines bots are powered by <it>Energy L2</it> can mine <nr>Coal</nr>, <nr>Iron Ore</nr>, <nr>Clay</nr> and <nr>Salt</nr> as well as mining <nr>Stone</nr>.
Shaft Mines tunnel into underground deposits so have to be placed in specific position related to the deposit. Use the building footprint to line up with the underground deposit.

You now have access to a Level 2 Surface Mine! Click the tab at the top of the construction panel to change the level of the building.
Level 2 Surface Mines bots are powered by <it>Energy L2</it> and can mine <nr>Coal</nr>, <nr>Iron Ore</nr> and <nr>Clay</nr> as well as mining <nr>Stone</nr> faster.
But remember, you can always choose to build Level 1 Surface Mines to mine <nr>Stone</nr> if you prefer or in the event you run out of <it>Stone</it> to construct Level 2 Surface Mines.

You've upgraded a <bd>Surface Mine</bd> to Level 2!
It's now capable of mining more advanced ores of <nr>Coal</nr>, <nr>Iron Ore</nr> and <nr>Clay</nr>.
Your Level 2 <bd>Surface Mine</bd> will still be set to mine its previous resource (<nr>Stone</nr>) so if you want it to mine <nr>Coal</nr> instead then you need to click on the mine's production panel and manually change it.

One of your <bd>Watchtowers</bd> is under attack!
Your repairbot will automatically request resources and repair the damage but you need to make sure you're producing enough resources to keep up!
If your Watchtower receives too much damage it will be captured by the enemy.

You've captured a hostile <bd>Watchtower</bd>!
It's currently damaged and a Guardbot can only occupy it once it's fully repaired.
Connect the <bd>Watchtower</bd> to your network and repair it quickly otherwise it will collapse!

You've lost one of your <bd>Watchtowers</bd>!
Research military technologies to improve your <bd>Watchtowers</bd> and make sure you have a good supply of resources!

You now have access to a Level 2 Watchtower!
While Level 2 Watchtowers give more territory they do require <it>Planks</it> and <it>Stone</it> for construction.
So if you don't have access to, or don't wish to use your <it>Stone</it> you are always able to expand your territory using Level 1 Watchtowers.

You now have a Level 2 <bd>Workshop</bd> which can research more advanced technologies!
Research <res>Mining I</res> so that you can begin mining the <nr>Coal</nr> and <nr>Iron Ore</nr> you need to make the <it>Iron</it> required for the <bd>Monument</bd>.

The Colonists is now available in English!

The Colonists is a relaxing settlement building game inspired by classic titles like The Settlers and the Anno series.

Take on a series of individual missions or build your colony unfettered by any constraints in the [b]sandbox mode[/b].

You take control of a team of self-replicating robots built to simulate human civilisation.  After escaping Earth, The Colonists are now free to roam the galaxy in search of a new home and construct their dream settlement.

You'll advance through three different Ages as you build infrastructure for your colony by constructing road, boat and train transport systems.

Harvest natural resources, set up farming and food production, create expeditions to discover new lands and research new technologies.

With two separate mission tracks, The Colonists lets either you create sprawling settlements in peace or race to compete against AI colonies in military winner-takes-all scenarios.

Explore, research, manage, tweak and refine to your heart's content.

An extensive map editor and Steam Workshop support is included, so you can create, share and play custom maps.
